definitions.definition: help and support from somebody to do something; financial support for something

examples.text: The police gave the proposals their full backing.
They have won financial backing from the EU.
The teachers have the full backing of the parents.
They brought the legal action with the backing of their MP.
They want backing for more research.
Who's going to provide the backing?
The museum has always received limited financial backing from the local authority.

definitions.definition: material attached to the back of something in order to protect it or make it stronger

examples.text: Remove the backing paper from the adhesive tape.
The fabric has a special backing for durability.

definitions.definition: music that goes with the main singer or tune

examples.text: Who did the **backing vocals** on that track?
